meanings.definition: Nearest in space, time, or relationship.
meanings.sent1: The proximate tree to our house is a tall oak.
meanings.sent2: The proximate bus stop is just around the corner.
meanings.sent3: I felt a proximate connection to the character in the book.
meanings.sent4: The proximate end of the tunnel seemed so far away.
meanings.sent5: The proximate sound of the waves crashing was soothing.

meanings.sent1: The proximate cause of the fire was a faulty wire.
meanings.sent2: She had a proximate response to the urgent situation.
meanings.sent3: The proximate solution to the puzzle was surprisingly simple.
meanings.sent4: His proximate gaze made her feel uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The proximate smell of freshly baked cookies filled the room.

meanings.sent1: The proximate building to the park is a library.
meanings.sent2: She is the proximate candidate for the job.
meanings.sent3: The proximate friend in the group always brings laughter.
meanings.sent4: The proximate color to blue is turquoise.
meanings.sent5: The proximate temperature to freezing is just above zero.
